simlib.core.Trajectory¶

class simlib.core.Trajectory(xyz, box=None, topology=None)[source]¶

Trajectory stores instantaneous data for a Topology, i.e., atomic coordinates, box information, velocity, etc.

Methods:

__init__(xyz, box=None, topology=None)[source]¶
Parameters

  • xyz (ArrayLike, three-dimensional) – Cartesian coordinates for all atoms and all structures. First axis must represent the structure index, second axis must represent the atom, and the third index will represent x, y, or z.

  • topology (Topology) –

center(weights=None)[source]¶

Compute the center of every structure in the Trajectory.

Returns

Center of every structure in the Trajectory.

Return type

numpy.ndarray

query(expr, only_index=False)[source]¶

Query the set Topology and return matching indices

Parameters

  • expr (str) – Selection text. See pandas.DataFrame.query

  • only_index (bool) – Should the entire Trajectory be returned, or only the array of indices?

Returns

Array of indices or Trajectory containing only expr.

Return type

numpy.ndarray or Trajectory
